meanings.definition: Reddening, inflammation, and, in severe cases, blistering and peeling of the skin caused by overexposure to the sun.
meanings.sent1: After spending all day at the beach without sunscreen, I got a painful sunburn.
meanings.sent2: She forgot to apply sunscreen and ended up with a bad sunburn on her shoulders.
meanings.sent3: Even though he wore a hat, his sunburn was so bad that he looked like a lobster.
meanings.sent4: The sunburn on her back was a fiery reminder of her forgetfulness.
meanings.sent5: The intense sunburn made her skin feel like it was on fire.

meanings.sent1: I always sunburn easily if I forget to reapply sunscreen.
meanings.sent2: If you stay out in the sun too long, you will sunburn.
meanings.sent3: He managed to sunburn even though he thought he had applied enough sunscreen.
meanings.sent4: Her fair skin tends to sunburn quickly under the hot sun.
meanings.sent5: Be careful not to sunburn your skin by staying out too long without protection.

meanings.sent1: His painful sunburn made it hard for him to sleep at night.
meanings.sent2: The sunburned condition of her skin was a result of spending too much time in the sun.
meanings.sent3: Despite the aloe vera, her sunburned condition still caused discomfort.
meanings.sent4: The sunburned condition of his face was a stark contrast to his pale arms.
meanings.sent5: The severity of her sunburned condition surprised everyone at the beach.
